meanings.definition: The state or quality of being homogenous.
meanings.sent1: The homogonies of the colors in the painting created a sense of harmony.
meanings.sent2: The homogonies of the ingredients made the soup taste delicious.
meanings.sent3: The homogonies of the students' answers on the test were surprisingly identical.
meanings.sent4: The homogonies of the stars in the night sky were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The homogonies of the flowers in the garden made it a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A group of similar or identical elements or parts.
meanings.sent1: The homogonies of the books on the shelf made it easy to organize.
meanings.sent2: The homogonies of the team members' skills led to their success.
meanings.sent3: The homogonies of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: The homogonies of the buildings in the city created a sense of unity.
meanings.sent5: The homogonies of the animals in the zoo fascinated the visitors.
